basics.name: Adrian Arjoca
basics.label: Undergraduate of Computer Science at Sup de Vinci Paris.
basics.summary: I'm the developer of AxOS, a cool and open-source and Linux distribution based on Arch Linux. I love spending my time creating something that not only looks good but also perfectly usable and practical. That's how AxOS came to life. I've been creating, updating and maintaining it for the last 4 years.

education.summary: I’m currently in my first year of computer science studies at Sup de Vinci in Paris. My goal is to earn a Master’s degree as an Expert in Architecture and Software Development.
My three years of high school were spent at Lycée Jules Ferry, where I studied science and technology. I learned a lot about electronics, computer science, and engineering.

projects.name: AxOS
projects.description: AxOS is a Linux distribution aimed on beauty and performances.
highlights: Using custom made apps such as an installer, a mirror database and more.
Designed to be elegant but still keeps his performances.

projects.name: Sleex
projects.description: The third desktop environment for AxOS
highlights: Made with QtQuick/Quickshell.
Has a lot of customization options.

projects.name: Epsilon
projects.description: Pacman wrapper and AUR helper for AxOS
highlights: Can search in the AUR and the Pacman repositories to find any packages.
Does the package build process when needed.

projects.name: Axinstall
highlights: Has a intuitive graphic interface using GTK.
Create a system on the disk instead of copying the live environement.
The user can chose which desktop and which kernel should be installed.

projects.name: SchoolNotesV2
projects.description: A web app where i post the notes i took in class to share them with my classmates or anyone else.
highlights: Using MDX pages for a better write efficiency and print formatting.
Each chapters are separated in different pages, each modules are separated in different sections.

projects.name: Axuralis
projects.description: A music player for AxOS with FLAC and discord RPC support.
highlights: Can play any music file.
Can be used with any Linux distribution.
Discord RPC support.

projects.name: JFCocktails
projects.description: High school final project, functional cocktail maching
highlights: Can be used either with a mobile app or the built-in screen.
Has a variety of 6 cocktails.

projects.name: Blockchain
projects.description: My final B1 project at Sup de Vinci
highlights: 15 pages about the blockchain and it's potential future
As practical project, deployed an ETH blockchain and a smart contract on a private network

projects.name: Axctl
highlights: Can handle system-level tasks
Can change the boot menu style and boot splash animation.

projects.name: DinoRun
projects.description: A parody of the Chrome Dino game where the dino is replaced by the IT guy of the school (his name is Dino, that's why)
highlights: Made in 1 day as Python school project.
Made with Pygame.

projects.name: Discord-RPC
projects.description: A simple Discord Rich Presence for AxOS
highlights: Shows the user's current desktop and the uptime of the system.
Show if the user is listening to music or using a know code editor.
Can be used with any other Linux distribution.

projects.name: This portfolio
projects.description: This portfolio, made with Astro and Tailwind.
highlights: Made with Astro and Tailwind.
Cool animations.

projects.name: ls
projects.description: My own ls command made with rust, absolutely useless
highlights: Handle flags such as -l, -a, -h, -r, -t, -R.
Can be used with any Linux distribution.

projects.name: Fakebat
projects.description: A linux kernel module that simulate the batery of a laptop. Made for testing purposes.
highlights: Can be used with any Linux distribution.
Can be used to test the power management of a laptop.
States such as capacity and charging status can be changed.

projects.name: Ginger Archive
projects.description: PDF Storage website for my high school engineering teacher.
highlights: Can store PDF files.
Backend and frontend are separated.

projects.name: JFEsport
projects.description: A website for my high school's esport club.
highlights: Has a calendar for the events.
Has a list of the games played.
Has a user specific dashboard with the user's stats and charts.
Has a session registration system.
